intro: Antirrhinum tortuosum, commonly known as the twisted snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems and clusters of tubular, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The flowers typically range in color from pink to red and are pollinated by insects such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The plant is also known for its ability to produce seeds that can remain viable in the soil for several years.
